item.title: pythonvpn - a dead simple VPN
item.content:encoded:
https://github.com/qwj/python-vpn

Quick Start

install via pip

2023-03-15 09:10:40 [chchang@ny ~ ]$ sudo pip install pvpn
Collecting pvpn
  Using cached pvpn-0.2.5-py3-none-any.whl (70 kB)
Requirement already satisfied: pycryptodome>=3.7.2 in /usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages (from pvpn) (3.17)
Requirement already satisfied: pproxy>=2.0.0 in /usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages (from pvpn) (2.7.8)
Installing collected packages: pvpn
Successfully installed pvpn-0.2.5
WARNING: Running pip as the 'root' user can result in broken permissions and conflicting behaviour with the system package manager. It is recommended to use a virtual environment instead: https://pip.pypa.io/warnings/venv
2023-03-15 09:10:47 [chchang@ny ~ ]$

run pvpn without password authenticate

2023-03-15 09:11:05 [chchang@ny ~ ]$ sudo pvpn
Serving on UDP :500 :4500...

run pvpn with password authenticatate

[2023-03-15 09:12:20 [chchang@ny ~ ]$ sudo pvpn -p somesecretpasswordhere
Serving on UDP :500 :4500...

run pvpn with wireguard ( God Damn , so easy !)

2023-03-15 09:13:14 [chchang@ny ~ ]$ sudo pvpn -wg 13000
Serving on UDP :500 :4500...
======== WIREGUARD SETTING ========
PublicKey: kwcC05qapsVA28hoRI86ZUk6qlLM8sc9mfeAaS8cuis=
===================================
Serving on UDP :13000 (WIREGUARD)...

create a IPSEC VPN in ubuntu 22.04

install packages

sudo apt install network-manager-l2tp-gnome

select L2TP (it's important !) in network manager panel

named your tunnel fill in your vpn server hostname/ip address in Gateway field and password , then click IPsec Settings

update some options in IPsec settings

enable VPN tunnel by clicking the button

if prompt to ask your password , just type the password again(should be auto saved !)

you can see some message in you pvpn console, all y our traffic should go through your vpn server now! (that easy huh ?)

things to be improved

  • run pvpn as system daemon
  • using wireguard instead IPSec (or different scenario ?)
  • IPSec will default route all your traffic , not good.
  • how to use command to bring up the tunnel in console ?

HackMD Note URL: https://hackmd.io/91m1vrf6Rc-rVUf92zTAuw

item.title: tepe - send messages to telegram bot - for publish
item.content:encoded:
repo: https://github.com/Hermitter/tepe

run
TEPE_TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=600000045:AA0000008-4z00006-B5Fg_HMjbsJWTR0000Uo tepe send -c 80000009 -m "ğŸ™ƒğŸ’£ğŸ¤¡" > /dev/null 2>&1
result

send files
TEPE_TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=600000045:AA0000008-4z00006-B5Fg_HMjbsJWTR0000Uo
tepe send -c 80000009 -m "burning time" /home/chchang/Downloads/E.jpg > /dev/null 2>&1
result

send file content
TEPE_TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=600000045:AA0000008-4z00006-B5Fg_HMjbsJWTR0000Uo tepe send -c 80000009 -m "`cat vimrc`"
result

item.title: install_brew.sh - for publish
item.content:encoded:
install brew for linux

#!/bin/bash

sudo apt-get install build-essential procps curl file git
/bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)"
if [ ! -f "/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/bin/brew" ] ; then
  test -d ~/.linuxbrew && eval "$(~/.linuxbrew/bin/brew shellenv)"
  test -d /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew && eval "$(/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/bin/brew shellenv)"
  test -r ~/.bash_profile && echo "eval \"\$($(brew --prefix)/bin/brew shellenv)\"" >> ~/.bash_profile
  echo "eval \"\$($(brew --prefix)/bin/brew shellenv)\"" >> ~/.profile
else
  echo "brew already installed , skip it !"
fi

!!! info
after installation , run these two commands
!!!

- Run these two commands in your terminal to add Homebrew to your PATH:
    (echo; echo 'eval "$(/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/bin/brew shellenv)"') >> /home/chchang/.profile
    eval "$(/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/bin/brew shellenv)"
- Install Homebrew's dependencies if you have sudo access:
    sudo apt-get install build-essential
  For more information, see:
    https://docs.brew.sh/Homebrew-on-Linux
- We recommend that you install GCC:
    brew install gcc
- Run brew help to get started
- Further documentation:
    https://docs.brew.sh

item.title: linux system tools - for publish
item.content:encoded:
fd

A simple, fast and user-friendly alternative to 'find'
https://github.com/sharkdp/fd

bat

A cat(1) clone with wings.

https://github.com/sharkdp/bat

dust

A more intuitive version of du in rust

https://github.com/bootandy/dust

duf

Disk Usage/Free Utility - a better 'df' alternative

https://github.com/muesli/duf

pgcli

Postgres CLI with autocompletion and syntax highlighting

lazydocker

The lazier way to manage everything docker

https://github.com/jesseduffield/lazydocker#installation

item.title: ANSI Color code in bash script
item.content:encoded:
some variables that you can use:

# Reset
NC='\033[0m'       # Text Reset

# Regular Colors
Black='\033[0;30m'        # Black
Red='\033[0;31m'          # Red
Green='\033[0;32m'        # Green
Yellow='\033[0;33m'       # Yellow
Blue='\033[0;34m'         # Blue
Purple='\033[0;35m'       # Purple
Cyan='\033[0;36m'         # Cyan
White='\033[0;37m'        # White

# Bold
BBlack='\033[1;30m'       # Black
BRed='\033[1;31m'         # Red
BGreen='\033[1;32m'       # Green
BYellow='\033[1;33m'      # Yellow
BBlue='\033[1;34m'        # Blue
BPurple='\033[1;35m'      # Purple
BCyan='\033[1;36m'        # Cyan
BWhite='\033[1;37m'       # White

item.title: å»ºç«‹ä¸€å€‹ user:passwd æ ¼å¼çš„æª”æ¡ˆ
item.content:encoded:
htpasswd è¦çš„å¸³è™Ÿå¯†ç¢¼å°æ‡‰
ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥æ‹¿ä¾†åšå…¶ä»–ç”¨é€”

- name: make sure /tmp/user_pass exists
  file:
    path: /tmp/user_pass
    state: touch
  
- name: register previous mapping
  shell: "cat /tmp/user_pass"
  register: "user_pass_reg"
  
- name: create user/password mapping yml
  lineinfile: 
    line: "{{ item.name }}:{{ lookup('ansible.builtin.password', '/dev/null length=8 chars=ascii_letters,digits') }}"
    path: /tmp/user_pass
  with_items: "{{ users_nopassword }}"
  when: not user_pass_reg.stdout.find(item.name) != -1
